caption_original: Bumped off of the Imperial Shuttle? Know your rights as an air passenger! #maythefourthbewithyou #starwars >http://ow.ly/mWo3303vdFx
caption_cleaned: Bumped off of the Imperial Shuttle? Know your rights as an air passenger! >

caption_original:
"We were returning from Baltimore to Toronto when our flight was cancelled due to poor weather. The airline rebooked us 5 days later because that was their only flight which had availability. Although there was availability on their partner flight, they would not book us on another airline. We could not wait for 5 days to return home, as a result, we purchased new flights. We tried to work with the airline to receive a refund but they refused to offer any compensation. Consequently, we turned to the Canadian Transportation Agency for assistance. Their service was amazing- very thorough, very comprehensive and very attentive. The first contact explained the passenger tariff and our rights as passengers. We took the next step and asked CTA to mediate on our behalf, which fortunately turned out to be a successful exercise. We were very impressed with the support we received and the professionalism of the staff at CTA. It is sad that the state of airline travel in Canada requires an agency such as the CTA but it is reassuring to know that they are there to help ensure passenger rights are met."

Marci

http://ow.ly/gv1230cASUR
caption_cleaned: "We were returning from Baltimore to Toronto when our flight was cancelled due to poor weather. The airline rebooked us days later because that was their only flight which had availability. Although there was availability on their partner flight, they would not book us on another airline. We could not wait for days to return home, as a result, we purchased new flights. We tried to work with the airline to receive a refund but they refused to offer any compensation. Consequently, we turned to the Canadian Transportation Agency for assistance. Their service was amazing- very thorough, very comprehensive and very attentive. The first contact elained the passenger tariff and our rights as passengers. We took the next step and asked CTA to mediate on our behalf, which fortunately turned out to be a successful exercise. We were very impressed with the support we received and the professionalism of the staff at CTA. It is sad that the state of airline travel in Canada requires an agency such as the CTA but it is reassuring to know that they are there to help ensure passenger rights are met." Marci

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Don't Miss Your Flight

When available, pre-select your seat in advance of departure. Confirm your return flight at least 72 hours in advance. Monitor your points of contact for carrier notifications of departure time changes and cancellations. Check your flight's status at least 24 hours before departure and leaving for the airport.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Don't Miss Your Flight When available, pre-select your seat in advance of departure. Confirm your return flight at least hours in advance. Monitor your points of contact for carrier notifications of departure time changes and cancellations. Check your flight's status at least hours before departure and leaving for the airport. > Top Tips >

caption_original: Did you know?  It's our responsibility to ensure that everyone enjoys the same access to travel. Since 1988, our mandate is to protect the human right of persons with disabilities to an accessible travel experience.  If you have an accessibility-related travel complaint, we may be able to help. Watch our video to understand our accessibility complaints process >   http://ow.ly/D83o301kiF0
caption_cleaned: Did you know? It's our responsibility to ensure that everyone enjoys the same access to travel. Since , our mandate is to protect the human right of persons with disabilities to an accessible travel eerience. If you have an accessibility-related travel complaint, we may be able to help. Watch our video to understand our accessibility complaints process > 0

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Have Insurance When You Travel

Include protection against baggage loss, delay, damage or theft, trip cancellation or interruption, personal injury or death, as well as sufficient medical coverage.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Have Insurance When You Travel Include protection against baggage loss, delay, damage or theft, trip cancellation or interruption, personal injury or death, as well as sufficient medical coverage. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Understand Your Rights and Responsibilities

The tariff is the contract of carriage between you and your air carrier – it covers your rights and obligations as a passenger and your carrier's rights and its responsibilities to you. Find it at the carrier's business offices in Canada and on their websites when used for selling air transportation. 

#FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Understand Your Rights and Responsibilities The tariff is the contract of carriage between you and your air carrier – it covers your rights and obligations as a passenger and your carrier's rights and its responsibilities to you. Find it at the carrier's business offices in Canada and on their websites when used for selling air transportation. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
There was a poor traveler named Terry
Whose every airline flight did miscarry.
His luggage arrived…
Somewhere else than his side.
So he made do with what he was wearing.

 
Having problems with your baggage? We may be able to help.

 
http://ow.ly/VSAX307jle3

 
#NationalLimerickDay

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents

It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit

All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Know Your Carrier's Limits

Each carrier sets out its own limits for carry-on and checked baggage. Carriers also set time limits for reporting and filing complaints about lost, damaged or delayed baggage. Check your carrier's tariff for its baggage rules and allowances.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Know Your Carrier's Limits Each carrier sets out its own limits for carry-on and checked baggage. Carriers also set time limits for reporting and filing complaints about lost, damaged or delayed baggage. Check your carrier's tariff for its baggage rules and allowances. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Know the fare rules for your ticket

Note or print the fare rules before purchasing and carry them with you when you travel – they can defend you if a dispute arises between you and the air carrier's agent.

#FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Know the fare rules for your ticket Note or print the fare rules before purchasing and carry them with you when you travel – they can defend you if a dispute arises between you and the air carrier's agent. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Check in Early

When available, check in on-line up to 24 hours in advance of your flight. Arrive at the airport early to check in, drop off your baggage, get through the security screening process and be available for boarding at the gate on time.

#FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Check in Early When available, check in on-line up to hours in advance of your flight. Arrive at the airport early to check in, drop off your baggage, get through the security screening process and be available for boarding at the gate on time. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Call Ahead

From carrying sports equipment and musical instruments, to dietary restrictions, medical conditions and disability-related needs, most carriers require from 48 to 72 hours notice to accommodate special requests.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
